rules.surveyText:
[ASK IF S2=1]

S3a. What type of Cardiologist are you primarily?
rules.plainTextRule: Show S3a only to respondents who selected 'Cardiologist' at S2.

rules.surveyText:
[ASK IF S2=6 OR 7]

S2a. In what type of doctor’s office do you work?
rules.plainTextRule: Show S2a only to respondents who selected Nurse Practitioner (S2=6) or Physician’s Assistant (S2=7).
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have S2 = 6 or S2 = 7.

rules.surveyText:
[ASK IF S2=1-5]

S4. Are you currently board certified or eligible in your specialty?
rules.plainTextRule: Show S4 only to respondents whose primary specialty/role (S2) is one of the listed physician specialties (S2 = 1,2,3,4,5).

rules.surveyText:
[ASK IF S2=2]

B5. How would you describe your specialty/training? Select all that apply.
rules.plainTextRule: Show B5 only to respondents who selected 'Internal Medicine / General Practitioner / Primary Care / Family Practice' at S2.

rules.surveyText:
A3a. ... ONLY SHOW THERAPY WHERE A3>0

A3a. For each treatment, approximately what % of those LAST 100 patients received that therapy in addition to a statin vs. without a statin? ... ONLY SHOW THERAPY WHERE A3>0
rules.plainTextRule: Within A3a, show a row for a given therapy only if the respondent entered a value greater than 0 for that therapy in A3 (their 'LAST 100' prescribing counts).
rules.conditionDescription: For each therapy row, display the row in A3a only when the corresponding A3 row value > 0.
rules.translationContext: A3 lists therapies (rows): 1=Statin only, 2=Leqvio (inclisiran), 3=Praluent (alirocumab), 4=Repatha (evolocumab), 5=Zetia (ezetimibe), 6=Nexletol/Nexlizet, 7=Other. A3a corresponds to the treatment rows (effectively A3 rows 2–6 and excludes 'Statin only' / 'Other' where not applicable). Downstream translation should map A3a rows to their originating A3 therapy rows and only show those where A3 > 0.

rules.surveyText:
A3b. ... ONLY SHOW ROWS FOR WHICH A3a COL B > 0

A3b. For each treatment you just indicated that you prescribe without a statin, approximately what % of those patients who received that therapy without a statin did so…
rules.plainTextRule: Within A3b, show a row for a given therapy only if that therapy's 'Without a statin' percentage (column B) in A3a is greater than 0.
rules.conditionDescription: For each therapy row, display the row in A3b only when the corresponding A3a column B (percentage 'without a statin') > 0.
rules.translationContext: A3a must be evaluated first. A3b rows correspond to the same therapy rows shown in A3a; only therapies with A3a column B > 0 are shown. Mapping of therapy rows is the same as noted for A3/A3a (Leqvio, Praluent, Repatha, Zetia, Nexletol, etc.).

rules.surveyText:
A4a. ... ONLY SHOW THERAPY WHERE A4>0

A4a. For each treatment, for approximately what % of those NEXT 100 patients would you expect to prescribe that therapy in addition to a statin vs. without a statin? ... ONLY SHOW THERAPY WHERE A4>0
rules.plainTextRule: Within A4a, show a row for a given therapy only if the respondent entered a value greater than 0 for that therapy in A4 (their 'NEXT 100' prescribing counts).
rules.conditionDescription: For each therapy row, display the row in A4a only when the corresponding A4 row value > 0.
rules.translationContext: A4 lists the same therapy rows as A3 (Statin only; Leqvio; Praluent; Repatha; Zetia; Nexletol; Other). A4a corresponds to the therapy rows and should show only those where A4 > 0. Downstream mapping should align A4a rows with their originating A4 therapy rows.

rules.surveyText:
A4b. ... ONLY SHOW ROWS FOR WHICH A4a COL B > 0

A4b. For each treatment you just indicated that you would expect to prescribe without a statin, approximately what % of those patients who would receive that therapy without a statin would do so…
rules.plainTextRule: Within A4b, show a row for a given therapy only if that therapy's 'Without a statin' percentage (column B) in A4a is greater than 0.
rules.conditionDescription: For each therapy row, display the row in A4b only when the corresponding A4a column B > 0.
rules.translationContext: A4b rows correspond to the same therapy rows shown in A4a; only therapies with A4a column B > 0 are shown. Mapping of therapy rows is the same as noted for A4/A4a (Leqvio, Praluent, Repatha, Zetia, Nexletol, etc.).

rules.surveyText:
ASK IF PRESCRIBING IN A4 is > or < A3 FOR ROWS 2, 3, OR 4 (LEQVIO, REPATHA, OR PRALUENT)

A5. How quickly might you expect to change your prescribing of PCSK9 inhibitors based on this indication change? _Select one_
rules.plainTextRule: Show A5 only to respondents whose prescribing in A4 differs (either increases or decreases) from A3 for any of the PCSK9 therapies: Leqvio, Praluent, or Repatha.
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have A4 value ≠ A3 value for at least one of the therapy rows corresponding to Leqvio (A row 2), Praluent (A row 3), or Repatha (A row 4).
rules.translationContext: A3 and A4 rows map to therapies as follows: A row 2 = Leqvio (inclisiran), row 3 = Praluent (alirocumab), row 4 = Repatha (evolocumab). The comparison is per-therapy (A4 vs A3) for those three specific therapies; show A5 if any of these three have A4 > A3 or A4 < A3 (i.e., A4 != A3).
